channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What to watch for during Casey Means' confirmation hearing for surgeon general
item.description: While she completed medical school, she never finished residency, and is likely to face tough questions from senators about her qualifications and vie...

item.title: Trump suggests the U.S. will resume testing nuclear weapons
item.description: President Donald Trump appeared to suggest the U.S. will resume testing nuclear weapons for the first time in three decades, saying it would be on an ...

item.title: Why car insurance costs have soared (and what drivers are doing about it)
item.description: Car insurance premiums have increased at twice the rate of overall inflation. They've stabilized, at least for now, but more than half of Americans sa...

item.title: Trump rates meeting with China's Xi '12 out of 10', lowers tariffs
item.description: President Trump said he and Chinese leader Xi Jinping "agreed to almost everything" in their nearly two-hour meeting in South Korea, which Trump said ...

item.title: Trump keeps flirting with the idea of a third term. That would be unconstitutional
item.description: A recent interview with Steve Bannon reignited chatter about whether President Trump would try to run in 2028, despite the 22nd Amendment.

item.title: Handshakes and whispers: Trump and Xi's meeting…in 73 seconds
item.description: Trump says the meeting with President Xi, which was their first face-to-face interaction since 2019, was a "great success".

item.title: Hurricane Melissa turning toward Bermuda. Maps show its forecast path.
item.description: Hurricane Melissa brought heavy rains and gusty winds to the Bahamas after hitting Jamaica Cuba and was beginning to eye Bermuda, forecasters said.

item.title: K-pop group NewJeans loses legal battle against agency
item.description: A South Korean court rules that the act's contract with the label, which runs until 2029, is valid.

item.title: Dutch centrist liberals neck and neck with populist Wilders in tight election
item.description: Rob Jetten's D66 party celebrates but with 90% of votes counted the result is too close to call.

item.title: Five new suspects arrested over Louvre jewellery theft
item.description: They were arrested on Wednesday night in the Paris region, Paris' public prosecutor said.

item.title: 10/29: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: President Trump and China's Xi Jinping to hold high stakes meeting in South Korea; New book argues superhuman AI puts humanity on path to extinction

item.title: Watch: US and China's different reports of their trade meeting
item.description: The BBC's Laura Bicker explains how the two nation's have reported on the trade negotiations.

item.title: 10/29: The Daily Report
item.description: Lindsey Reiser reports on the damage left behind in Jamaica after Hurricane Melissa, and what to expect when President Trump meets with President Xi.

item.title: DOJ prepares to send election monitors to California, New Jersey following requests from state GOPs
